comment: Professor Lumpkin is so knowledgeable and his assignments really teach you how to think and research. Def take him!

He was amazing. We had 3 essays, a writing portfolio, and a final research paper, for which he provided clear and lenient grading criteria. He also allows a redo submission on the first essay for a better grade. The downside is mandatory attendance, but each day we had a debate over relevant topics (barely any lecture), so it makes it worthwhile.

His class was very engaging, my class was hybrid. We had an argument of the week where he makes basically everyone participate and he tries to make you think harder and deeper during them. There was also like three or four papers and a portfolio for his class super easy as long as you follow his rubric and stay on top of things.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Lumpkin is a great professor. There are three major papers that you have to write, then a Writing Portfolio that we had and the Final Essay. He's very clear about what he wants as far as length of papers, content matter, citations etc. I would definitely recommend taking him, you learn a lot but it's not difficult.

For English 1102 he was a great teacher. His lectures and arguments of the week are always very interesting. He is very helpful with the papers and answers his emails well too. Don't but the textbook, you don't need it al all.

I took his hybrid class where we were only needed to attend one day a week, his class is very laid out and structured for the entire semester. The workload is very fair for each week, and he is an extremely fair grader and gives lots of opportunities for extra credit if you ask. lectures are also very interesting, im happy to say i learned a lot.

In this class you have to write a lot of essays. Even though class was not mandatory due to COVID nothing he does in class is posted online, so you kind of have to go to class to know what your essay is suppose to be about. DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK!!!! It is completely useless and you can get an A without it.

He's a really good professor, as long as you do the work you should get a good grade. Didn't really use the textbook much, and there's a weekly assignment where you have to write a page on a said topic. There are also 4 essays that you have to do including the final essay. Just do the work and pay attention and you should do well!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: 15 writing response = 15% of grade. Very easy to do, takes 1 hour to do. 5% participation. 4 essays = 80%, if you just follow rubric you will easily get a 90% or above.

A monster-themed ENGL1101 course.

There were Writing Responses due most every week that are essentially participation assignments as long as you don't repeatedly do anything egregious, which we then discussed in class.

The grade hinges on four 20-point papers, but the rubric is clear and it makes it super easy. 
Tip: Go to the writing center.

I would say although I am freshman Professor Lumpkin will always be one of my all time favorite teachers. My only regret is not going to ALL of his classes, his class format is centered around horror/monsters and even as someone who love this genre I was always learning of new stories. I loved going just to hear the monster story of the week.

It's weekly writing assignment (1 page) and a monthly essay (3-5 pages) and that's it. The class lectures are monster themed, but I don't think you need to be a fan of horror to enjoy it.

I would say however if you trust your writing skills, you don't need to show up to class every single time, just make sure you get your assignments turned in.
Great lectures, love to come to class just to hear his discussions on the reading of the week which has been entirely horror and monster story themed
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: I had Mr. Lumpkin for a hybrid course during the Fall 2021 semester and I thoroughly enjoyed the class. The class was entirely focused on horror/monsters. There are 4 essays, which is a lot, however, if you follow the rubric you'll do very well (I got a 100 on all of them). Still one of the best courses I've taken so far.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Super interesting class! Teacher is super chill. I recommend it. Easy A

Professor Lumpkin taught one of the most interesting classes I've ever had. Our theme was monsters and the way in which he talks about everything continued to have me intrigued throughout the class. We have three essays plus the final essay (4 total) and the lowest grade I ever got was a 90. There are also weekly small writing assignments (easy)
I highly recommend anyone to take him. His class is such a easy class and hes a great teacher.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This was probably my most favorite professor. The whole class is focused around monsters and horror, so for me it was able to keep my interest. Something around 80% of the grade is from three or four essays, three pages long. So if you're good at writing and do the weekly writing prompts you'll have no problem passing with an A.

A really nice guy if you interact and engage in the lectures. If you don't go to class and do not care about the class you will not like him, but if you care about the class and want to do well he will gladly help.

Best Prof I've taken yet. Lumpkin is the only comp class you can actually stay engaged in. Super interesting material which is hard to do in a comp class, so insane respect for that. Also very inviting if you have questions about grades which consist of writing responses every week and 3-4 essays. Definitely take this class, you won't regret it.

Mr. Lumpkin is the best professor here at KSU! His lectures are always interesting and he really keeps you engaged by using lots of videos and pictures. He does weekly writing responses which are only a page long. The writing response topics are usually personal and super easy to write about! I would absolutely take this class 10 times again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: A really cool course, never had a teacher that focused only on monsters but I really learned a lot. He gives out weekly readings but he usually ends up talking about it himself, might be different if you don't take the hybrid course though. You turn in a weekly one page on an assigned topic and you also have 4/5 4 page min essays. RUBRICKsuccess

I took Professor Lumpkin in the Fall and I loved him. I really recommend him, hes a great professor and his topics are often intriguing to write about. As far as essays, you will have to really work hard to get an A but its do-able and hes always accessible if you struggle with English. I really wish I could take him again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: MY FAV TEACHER!!!! he's a really good and understanding teacher. but what you want to hear is that he gives out "writing responses" EVERY WEEK! so these are typically only one page required (MLA format) so also 4 essays including finals (4-6 pages long). if you are uncomfortable with the writing topic, tell him, and he'll give u another one.

There were about 4 papers, including the final essay. The grading criteria was clear and easy to understand. As an instructor, he can become a bit long-winded during lectures. Homework included various writing topics which is an easy 1 page reflection. However some of the topics were pushing the lines of certain boundaries..

comment: He is a fantastic teacher. He will really go out of his way to see you through the semester, even if you did not do so hot. He uses a lot of pictures/ videos in his class to really keep your attention.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Lumpkin is by far one of the best professors I've had at KSU so far! He's a fair grader and gives actual feedback that really helps you get used to writing at a college level. He's also very personable and his lectures were always interesting with good content and even a few memes (outdated but seemed ironic so still funny!) great class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Lumpkin is a great teacher. Lots of writing assignments that aren't very difficult so if you like writing you should take this class. It is a great start to writing at a college level and he gives good feedback. You earn the grade you are given so while assignments are easy you still need to put in effort. Really enjoyed the class!

This class wasn't an easy A and you have to write good papers to get the grade you want. We had three big essays (3-4 pages) and one page papers due every week over easy topics. You have to share to the class what your one page paper was about so be ready to participate. You have to buy the textbook also. He gives good feedback on essays. Take him!

comment: Mr. Lumpkin is probably one of the coolest teachers/professors that I have had. He's nonchalant and cares about his students. I used to hate writing any kind of paper before this class before doing near-weekly 1-page papers, and his supportive feedback made me a more confident writer. 11/10 professor and I wish he also taught ENGL 1102.
